definition: to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
four/4
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.chinese: 能给我来一杯四海为家吗？

sentences.english: Time flies, and friends are scattered around.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，朋友四海为家。

sentences.english: The wise man is his home, the earth is his living room fireplace, blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 明智者四海为家，地球是他的壁炉，蓝天是他的客厅。

sentences.english: His whereabouts are uncertain – he could be living anywhere.
They felt themselves cosmopolitans and as such held close relationships with one another.
sentences.chinese: 他们自视为四海为家者，并彼此关系密切。

definition: to roam far and wide (idiom)/to travel the world
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
to aspire to travel far and make one's mark (idiom)
to roam far and wide/to drift with the wind
to roam about/to wander without a home
to have no cares/to be carefree
to travel far/distant wanderings
to be all alone in the world
to travel extensively
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
to travel around the country
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
drifting aimlessly all over the place (idiom)
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
